card.text: ■ Blocker ■ This creature can't attack players.

card.name: Bolbalzak "Sword Flash" Dragon
card.text: ■ Double Breaker ■ Samurai Generation ■ Each turn, you may untap this creature the first time it's tapped.

card.name: Living Lithograph
card.text: ■ Put the top card of your deck into your mana zone. If that card is a creature, each of your creatures in the battle zone gets +2000 power until the End Step

card.name: Perfect Galaxy, Immortality Elemental
card.text: ■ Double Breaker ■ Shield Force

card.name: Dragon Gear - Zangeki Mach Armor
card.text: ■ Cross Gear Effect ■ While this card isn't crossed with a creature, your Dragon and Samurai creatures may each cost 1 less to summon. They can't cost less than 1. ■ While this card is crossed with a Dragon or Samurai creature, each of your Dragon and Samurai creatures in the battle zone gets +2000 power and "speed attacker". ■ This card may be crossed with "tooltip

card.name: Romanov the 1st, Lord of the Demonic Eye
card.text: ■ Double Breaker ■ When you put this creature, search your deck. You may take a darkness card from your deck and put it into your graveyard. Then shuffle your deck. ■ Whenever this creature attacks, you may cast a darkness spell that costs 6 or less from your graveyard For No Cost

card.name: Fernando the 7th, Emperor of Mystic Light
card.text: ■ You may have this creature cost 1 less for each spell in your graveyard. It can't cost less than 1. ■ Whenever this creature attacks, choose one of your opponent's creatures in the battle zone. For each spell in your graveyard, that creature gets -1000 power until the End Step ■ Double Breaker

card.name: Bell Hell De Dios, Death Castle Beast Lord
card.text: ■ Whenever this creature attacks, you may destroy one of your creatures. If you do, draw 2 cards. ■ Double Breaker

card.name: Chief De Baula, Machine King of Mystic Light
card.text: ■ Blocker ■ This creature can't attack players. ■ When you put this creature into the battle zone, you may return a spell from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Riku, the Oracle
card.text: ■ Shield Trigger ■ When you put this creature, if you have 2 shields or less, you may shieldify the top card of your deck.

card.name: Cutie Heart
card.text: ■ Shield Trigger ■ When you put this creature into the battle zone, if you have 2 or fewer shields, you may choose a creature in the battle zone and return it to its owner's hand. ■ While you have 2 or fewer shields, this creature gets +4000 power and can't be blocked.

card.name: Huckle Kirin Sawyer, Jungle Governor
card.text: ■ Mana Evolution ■ Shield Force

card.name: Ascendant Wing - Faerie Accela

card.name: Poppo "Yatarou" Pappi
card.text: ■ Saver: Dragon or Samurai creatures ''(When one of your Dragons or Samurai creatures would be destroyed, you may destroy this creature instead.)''

card.name: JK Paper Nature
card.text: ■ Whenever this creature attacks, you may play Rock-Paper-Scissors with your opponent. If you win, put one of your opponent's creatures that has power 5000 or less into its owner's mana zone. ■ If your opponent throws "scissors" during Rock-Paper-Scissors, you may put the top card of your deck into your mana zone.

card.text: ■ Whenever this creature is attacked, return a shield to your hand. You can't use the "shield trigger" ability of that shield.

card.name: Supernova Ares Varmingam
card.text: ■ Mana Vortex evolution—Choose 2 fire creatures in your mana zone and put this creature into the battle zone on top of those creatures. ■ Meteorburn—Whenever this creature attacks, you may put a card under this creature into your graveyard. If you do, destroy all your opponent's creatures that have "blocker" that cost 3 or less. ■ Double Breaker

card.text: ■ When you put this creature into the battle zone, reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. You may put any number of spells revealed in this way into your hand, and the rest on the bottom of your deck in any order.

card.name: Aqua Belala
card.text: ■ Whenever you put another creature into the battle zone, you may look at the top card of either player's deck. Then you may put that card on the bottom of that player's deck.
